title: Birthright: A Vision into the Plight of Southeastern Indigenous Culture through the Eyes of Guernica
creator: John Henry Gloyne
description: A "remix of Picassos Guernica" that "depicts the horrors of colonialism and mound desecration from a Cherokee perspective."
subject: Cherokee;animals;death;mound

title: Jar
creator: Unknown
description: A porcelain jar from the Kangxi era (1662-1722) containing European bronze mounts.
subject: vase;porcelain

title: Choiyi Hissi Asaala (Coushatta Longleaf Pine Needle Basket)
creator: Landon Riley Heath Diagle
description: A woven, dual shaded, pineneedle basket with top, featuring  pinecones and dyed raffia embedded in its top.
subject: basket;Coushatta;traditional;weaving

title: The Sun Dances Around the People
creator: Vivian Garner Cottrell
description: A dual-toned, open topped basket decorated with traditional designs, including those of the sun, made of doublewoven rivercane.
subject: basket;Cherokee;weaving;décor

title: Days Past
creator: Aaron Lambert
description: A painting depicting a sacred mound surrounding by residential dwellings, alongside a river in the midst of the mountains of Western North Carolina.
subject: painting;Cherokee;WesternNC;river;mound;village
